alert.note: Alert for Albany; Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 6:10PM MDT until July 04 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Southwestern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 700 PM MDT. * At 610 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Tie City Campground to 6 miles south of Buford to near Virginia Dale, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo, Federal, Tie Siding, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Pumpkin Vine, Crystal Lake Campground, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford, North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Granite Springs Campground, Yellow Pine Campground and The Buttes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 320 and 357. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
